tr.td: AFF-01.00.00 - Set ID.00 - AFF
SI
AFF-02.00.0 - Professional Organization
XON
AFF-02.01.00 - Professional Organization : Organization Name
The name of the specified organization.
ST
AFF-02.02.00 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code
A code that represents the type of name i.e., legal name, display name. Refer to User-defined Table 0204 - Organizational Name Type for suggested values.
CWE
AFF-02.02.01 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Differ-ent coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
AFF-02.02.02 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
AFF-02.02.03 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Name of Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ST
AFF-02.02.04 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Alternate Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Differ-ent coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
AFF-02.02.05 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Alternate Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
AFF-02.02.06 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Alternate Name of Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ST
AFF-02.02.07 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Coding System Version ID

This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.
ST
AFF-02.02.08 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Alternate Coding System Version ID
This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6. Analogous To CWE.7 - Coding System Version ID.
ST
AFF-02.02.09 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Original Text

The text as seen and/or selected by the user who entered the data. Original text can be used in a structured user interface to capture what the user saw as a representation of the code on the data input screen, or in a situation where the user dictates or directly enters text, it is the text entered or uttered by the user. In a situation where the code is assigned sometime after the text was entered, original text is the text or phrase used as the basis for assigning the code.
ST
AFF-02.02.10 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Second Alternate Identifier
A sequence of characters that uniquely identifies a second alternate code. Analogous to CWE.1- Identifier.
ST
AFF-02.02.11 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Second Alternate Text
The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to CWE.2 - Text. See usage note in section introduction.
ST
AFF-02.02.12 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Name of Second Alternate Coding System

Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to CWE.3 Name of Coding System. See usage note in section introduction.
As of v2.7 this component is required when CWE.10 is populated and CWE.20 is not populated. Both CWE.6 and CWE.17 may be populated. Receivers should not identify a code based on its position within the tuples (Identifier, Alternate Identifier, or Second Alternate Identifier) or position within a repeating field. Instead, the receiver should always examine the coding System as specified in CWE.12 and/or CWE.20, the "Coding System" component or the "Coding System OID", for the tuple.
ID
AFF-02.02.13 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 10-12. Analogous to CWE.7 - Coding System Version ID.
ST
AFF-02.02.14 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Coding System OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.3. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
This component is required when CWE.1 is populated and CWE.3 is not populated. Both CWE.3 and CWE.14 may be populated.
ST
AFF-02.02.15 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ST
AFF-02.02.16 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Value Set Version ID

This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.15. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
Value set version ID is required if CWE.15 is populated.
DTM
AFF-02.02.17 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Alternate Coding System OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.6. Analogous to CWE.14 Coding System OID.
The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
This component is required when CWE.4 is populated and CWE.6 is not populated. Both CWE.6 and CWE.17 may be populated.
ST
AFF-02.02.18 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Alternate Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.4 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ST
AFF-02.02.19 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Alternate Value Set Version ID

This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.18. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
Value set version ID is required if CWE.18 is populated.
DTM
AFF-02.02.20 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Second Alternate Coding System OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.12. Analogous to CWE.14 - Coding System OID.
The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
This component is required when CWE.10 is populated and CWE.12 is not populated. Both CWE.12 and CWE.20 may be populated.
ST
AFF-02.02.21 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Second Alternate Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.10 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ST
AFF-02.02.22 - Professional Organization : Organization Name Type Code : Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.21. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
Value set version ID is required if CWE.21 is populated.
DTM
AFF-02.03.00 - Professional Organization : ID Number
NM
AFF-02.04.00 - Professional Organization : Identifier Check Digit

The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.
NM
AFF-02.05.00 - Professional Organization : Check Digit Scheme

Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.
The check digit scheme codes are defined in HL7 Table 0061 - Check digit scheme.
ID
AFF-02.06.00 - Professional Organization : Assigning Authority

The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Assigning authorities are unique across a given HL7 implementation. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning Authority for suggested values.
HD
AFF-02.06.01 - Professional Organization : Assigning Authority : Namespace ID
User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.
IS
AFF-02.06.02 - Professional Organization : Assigning Authority : Universal ID

The HD’s second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time with-in the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UID’s (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).
ST
AFF-02.06.03 - Professional Organization : Assigning Authority : Universal ID Type

The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third compo-nent is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second compo-nent is a universal ID of that type.
ID
AFF-02.07.00 - Professional Organization : Identifier Type Code

A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the "Assigning authority" component. Refer to HL7 Table 0203 - Identifier Type for suggested values.
ID
AFF-02.08.00 - Professional Organization : Assigning Facility

The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.
HD
AFF-02.08.01 - Professional Organization : Assigning Facility : Namespace ID
User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.
IS
AFF-02.08.02 - Professional Organization : Assigning Facility : Universal ID

The HD’s second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time with-in the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UID’s (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).
ST
AFF-02.08.03 - Professional Organization : Assigning Facility : Universal ID Type

The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third compo-nent is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second compo-nent is a universal ID of that type.
ID
AFF-02.09.00 - Professional Organization : Name Representation Code

Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.
Refer to HL7 Table 0465 – Name/address Representation Code for valid values.
ID
AFF-02.10.00 - Professional Organization : Organization Identifier
This component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by XON.1 Organization Name. This component replaces XON.3 ID Number as of v 2.5.
ST
AFF-03.00.00 - Professional Organization Address
XAD
AFF-03.01.00 - Professional Organization Address : Street Address
This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, and similar address information.
SAD
AFF-03.01.01 - Professional Organization Address : Street Address : Street or Mailing Address

This component specifies the street or mailing address of a person or institution. When referencing an institution, this first component is used to specify the institution name. When used in connection with a person, this component specifies the first line of the address.
ST
AFF-03.01.02 - Professional Organization Address : Street Address : Street Name
ST
AFF-03.01.03 - Professional Organization Address : Street Address : Dwelling Number
ST
AFF-03.02.00 - Professional Organization Address : Other Designation

This component contains the second line of address. In US usage, it qualifies address. Examples: Suite 555 or Fourth Floor. When referencing an institution, this component specifies the street address.
ST
AFF-03.03.00 - Professional Organization Address : City
This component specifies the city, or district or place where the addressee is located depending upon the national convention for formatting addresses for postal usage.
ST
AFF-03.04.00 - Professional Organization Address : State or Province
This component specifies the state or province where the addressee is located. State or province should be represented by the official postal service codes for that country.
ST
AFF-03.05.00 - Professional Organization Address : Zip or Postal Code

This component specifies the zip or postal code where the addressee is located. Zip or postal codes should be represented by the official codes for that country. In the US, the zip code takes the form 99999[-9999], while the Canadian postal code takes the form A9A9A9, and the Australian Postcode takes the form 9999.
ST
AFF-03.06.00 - Professional Organization Address : Country
This component specifies the country where the addressee is located. HL7 specifies that the 3-character (alphabetic) form of ISO 3166 be used for the country code.
ID
AFF-03.07.00 - Professional Organization Address : Address Type
This component specifies the kind or type of address.
ID
AFF-03.08.00 - Professional Organization Address : Other Geographic Designation
This component specifies any other geographic designation. It includes county, bioregion, SMSA, etc.
ST
AFF-03.09.00 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code

A code that represents the county in which the specified address resides. User-defined Table 0289 - County/parish is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. When this component is used to represent the county (or parish), component 8 <other geographic designation> should not duplicate it (i.e., the use of <other geographic designation> to represent the county is allowed only for the purpose of backward compatibility, and should be discouraged in this and future versions of HL7).
CWE
AFF-03.09.01 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Differ-ent coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
AFF-03.09.02 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
AFF-03.09.03 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Name of Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ST
AFF-03.09.04 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Alternate Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Differ-ent coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
AFF-03.09.05 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Alternate Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
AFF-03.09.06 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Alternate Name of Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ST
AFF-03.09.07 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Coding System Version ID

This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.
ST
AFF-03.09.08 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Alternate Coding System Version ID
This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6. Analogous To CWE.7 - Coding System Version ID.
ST
AFF-03.09.09 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Original Text

The text as seen and/or selected by the user who entered the data. Original text can be used in a structured user interface to capture what the user saw as a representation of the code on the data input screen, or in a situation where the user dictates or directly enters text, it is the text entered or uttered by the user. In a situation where the code is assigned sometime after the text was entered, original text is the text or phrase used as the basis for assigning the code.
ST
AFF-03.09.10 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Second Alternate Identifier
A sequence of characters that uniquely identifies a second alternate code. Analogous to CWE.1- Identifier.
ST
AFF-03.09.11 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Second Alternate Text
The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to CWE.2 - Text. See usage note in section introduction.
ST
AFF-03.09.12 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Name of Second Alternate Coding System

Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to CWE.3 Name of Coding System. See usage note in section introduction.
As of v2.7 this component is required when CWE.10 is populated and CWE.20 is not populated. Both CWE.6 and CWE.17 may be populated. Receivers should not identify a code based on its position within the tuples (Identifier, Alternate Identifier, or Second Alternate Identifier) or position within a repeating field. Instead, the receiver should always examine the coding System as specified in CWE.12 and/or CWE.20, the "Coding System" component or the "Coding System OID", for the tuple.
ID
AFF-03.09.13 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 10-12. Analogous to CWE.7 - Coding System Version ID.
ST
AFF-03.09.14 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Coding System OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.3. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
This component is required when CWE.1 is populated and CWE.3 is not populated. Both CWE.3 and CWE.14 may be populated.
ST
AFF-03.09.15 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ST
AFF-03.09.16 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Value Set Version ID

This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.15. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
Value set version ID is required if CWE.15 is populated.
DTM
AFF-03.09.17 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Alternate Coding System OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.6. Analogous to CWE.14 Coding System OID.
The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
This component is required when CWE.4 is populated and CWE.6 is not populated. Both CWE.6 and CWE.17 may be populated.
ST
AFF-03.09.18 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Alternate Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.4 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ST
AFF-03.09.19 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Alternate Value Set Version ID

This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.18. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
Value set version ID is required if CWE.18 is populated.
DTM
AFF-03.09.20 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Second Alternate Coding System OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.12. Analogous to CWE.14 - Coding System OID.
The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
This component is required when CWE.10 is populated and CWE.12 is not populated. Both CWE.12 and CWE.20 may be populated.
ST
AFF-03.09.21 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Second Alternate Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.10 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ST
AFF-03.09.22 - Professional Organization Address : County/Parish Code : Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.21. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
Value set version ID is required if CWE.21 is populated.
DTM
AFF-03.10.00 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract
A code that represents the census tract in which the specified address resides.
CWE
AFF-03.10.01 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Differ-ent coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
AFF-03.10.02 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
AFF-03.10.03 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Name of Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ST
AFF-03.10.04 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Alternate Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Differ-ent coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
AFF-03.10.05 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Alternate Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
AFF-03.10.06 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Alternate Name of Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ST
AFF-03.10.07 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Coding System Version ID

This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.
ST
AFF-03.10.08 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Alternate Coding System Version ID
This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6. Analogous To CWE.7 - Coding System Version ID.
ST
AFF-03.10.09 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Original Text

The text as seen and/or selected by the user who entered the data. Original text can be used in a structured user interface to capture what the user saw as a representation of the code on the data input screen, or in a situation where the user dictates or directly enters text, it is the text entered or uttered by the user. In a situation where the code is assigned sometime after the text was entered, original text is the text or phrase used as the basis for assigning the code.
ST
AFF-03.10.10 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Second Alternate Identifier
A sequence of characters that uniquely identifies a second alternate code. Analogous to CWE.1- Identifier.
ST
AFF-03.10.11 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Second Alternate Text
The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to CWE.2 - Text. See usage note in section introduction.
ST
AFF-03.10.12 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Name of Second Alternate Coding System

Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to CWE.3 Name of Coding System. See usage note in section introduction.
As of v2.7 this component is required when CWE.10 is populated and CWE.20 is not populated. Both CWE.6 and CWE.17 may be populated. Receivers should not identify a code based on its position within the tuples (Identifier, Alternate Identifier, or Second Alternate Identifier) or position within a repeating field. Instead, the receiver should always examine the coding System as specified in CWE.12 and/or CWE.20, the "Coding System" component or the "Coding System OID", for the tuple.
ID
AFF-03.10.13 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 10-12. Analogous to CWE.7 - Coding System Version ID.
ST
AFF-03.10.14 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Coding System OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.3. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
This component is required when CWE.1 is populated and CWE.3 is not populated. Both CWE.3 and CWE.14 may be populated.
ST
AFF-03.10.15 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ST
AFF-03.10.16 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Value Set Version ID

This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.15. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
Value set version ID is required if CWE.15 is populated.
DTM
AFF-03.10.17 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Alternate Coding System OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.6. Analogous to CWE.14 Coding System OID.
The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
This component is required when CWE.4 is populated and CWE.6 is not populated. Both CWE.6 and CWE.17 may be populated.
ST
AFF-03.10.18 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Alternate Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.4 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ST
AFF-03.10.19 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Alternate Value Set Version ID

This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.18. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
Value set version ID is required if CWE.18 is populated.
DTM
AFF-03.10.20 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Second Alternate Coding System OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.12. Analogous to CWE.14 - Coding System OID.
The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
This component is required when CWE.10 is populated and CWE.12 is not populated. Both CWE.12 and CWE.20 may be populated.
ST
AFF-03.10.21 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Second Alternate Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.10 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ST
AFF-03.10.22 - Professional Organization Address : Census Tract : Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.21. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
Value set version ID is required if CWE.21 is populated.
DTM
AFF-03.11:00 - Professional Organization Address : Address Representation Code

Different <name/address types> and representations of the same name/address should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.
ID
AFF-03.12.00 - Professional Organization Address : Address Validity Range
AFF-03.13.00 - Professional Organization Address : Effective Date
The first date, if known, on which the address is valid and active for the ‘owning’ entity.
DTM
AFF-03.14.00 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Date
The last date, if known, on which the address is valid and active for the ‘owning’ entity.
DTM
AFF-03.15.00 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason
This identifies why this address was marked as "ended".
CWE
AFF-03.15.01 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Differ-ent coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
AFF-03.15.02 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
AFF-03.15.03 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Name of Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ST
AFF-03.15.04 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Alternate Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Differ-ent coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
AFF-03.15.05 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Alternate Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
AFF-03.15.06 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Alternate Name of Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ST
AFF-03.15.07 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Coding System Version ID

This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.
ST
AFF-03.15.08 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Alternate Coding System Version ID
This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6. Analogous To CWE.7 - Coding System Version ID.
ST
AFF-03.15.09 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Original Text

The text as seen and/or selected by the user who entered the data. Original text can be used in a structured user interface to capture what the user saw as a representation of the code on the data input screen, or in a situation where the user dictates or directly enters text, it is the text entered or uttered by the user. In a situation where the code is assigned sometime after the text was entered, original text is the text or phrase used as the basis for assigning the code.
ST
AFF-03.15.10 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Second Alternate Identifier
A sequence of characters that uniquely identifies a second alternate code. Analogous to CWE.1- Identifier.
ST
AFF-03.15.11 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Second Alternate Text
The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to CWE.2 - Text. See usage note in section introduction.
ST
AFF-03.15.12 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Name of Second Alternate Coding System

Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to CWE.3 Name of Coding System. See usage note in section introduction.
As of v2.7 this component is required when CWE.10 is populated and CWE.20 is not populated. Both CWE.6 and CWE.17 may be populated. Instead, the receiver should always examine the coding System as specified in CWE.12 and/or CWE.20, the "Coding System" component or the "Coding System OID", for the tuple.
ID

This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 10-12. Analogous to CWE.7 - Coding System Version ID.
ST

This component is required when CWE.1 is populated and CWE.3 is not populated. Both CWE.3 and CWE.14 may be populated.
ST

The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ST

This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.15. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
Value set version ID is required if CWE.15 is populated.
DTM

ST
AFF-03.15.22 - Professional Organization Address : Expiration Reason : Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.21. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
Value set version ID is required if CWE.21 is populated.
DTM
AFF-03.16.00 - Professional Organization Address : Temporary Indicator
If "Y" this indicates that the address is considered temporary.
ID
AFF-03.17.00 - Professional Organization Address : Bad Address Indicator
If "Y", this indicates that it is not possible to contact the "owning" entity at this address.
ID
AFF-03.18.00 - Professional Organization Address : Address Usage
This indicates how the address is intended to be used.
ID
AFF-03.19.00 - Professional Organization Address : Addressee
Identifies the name of the person or organization that should appear as part of the address. This is also known as the "Care of" or "C/O" line.
ST
AFF-03.20.00 - Professional Organization Address : Comment
Descriptive information about the use of the address.
ST
AFF-03.21.00 - Professional Organization Address : Preference Order
For an entity having multiple addresses, indicates which is the 'most preferred' (lowest number) to 'least preferred' (highest number).
NM
AFF-03.22.00 - Professional Organization Address : Protection Code

Identifies that an address needs to be treated with special care or sensitivity.
The specific set of codes and appropriate handling of such addresses will vary by jurisdiction and is subject to site-specific negotiation. For example, a provider address marked as 'unlisted' might not be printed in an internal address listing.
CWE
AFF-03.22.01 - Professional Organization Address : Protection Code : Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Differ-ent coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
AFF-03.22.02 - Professional Organization Address : Protection Code : Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
AFF-03.22.03 - Professional Organization Address : Protection Code : Name of Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ST
AFF-03.22.04 - Professional Organization Address : Protection Code : Alternate Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Differ-ent coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
AFF-03.22.05 - Professional Organization Address : Protection Code : Alternate Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
AFF-03.22.06 - Professional Organization Address : Protection Code : Alternate Name of Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ST

If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

DTM
AFF-03.23.00 - Professional Organization Address : Address Identifier
A unique identifier for the address.
EI
AFF-03.23.01 - Professional Organization Address : Address Identifier : Entity Identifier

The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".
ST
AFF-03.23.02 - Professional Organization Address : Address Identifier : Namespace ID
See Section 2.A.33.1, "Namespace ID (IS)" for definition. The component intentionally remains associated with the IS data type in v 2.7.
IS
AFF-03.23.03 - Professional Organization Address : Address Identifier : Universal ID
See Section 2.A.33.2, "Universal ID (ST)" for definition.
ST
AFF-03.23.04 - Professional Organization Address : Universal ID Type
See Section 2.A.33.3, "Universal ID Type (ID)," for definition.
ID
AFF-04.00.00 - Professional Organization Affiliation Date Range
DR
AFF-04.01.00 - Professional Organization Affiliation Date Range : Range Start Date/Time
DTM
AFF-04.02.00 - Professional Organization Affiliation Date Range : Range End Date/Time
DTM
AFF-05.00.00 - Professional Affiliation Additional Information
ST
